artURL 
  public String artURL
The end of a URL from which to get the art for this cel. This can also be thought of as a relative file name.

  public boolean flipX
True if the art should be flipped horizontally.

True if the art should be flipped vertically.

getAttachmentPoint 
  public RegistrationPoint getAttachmentPoint()
The name and offset (from top-left of image after any rotation or flipping) of the registration point that connects this cel to its containing segment
getUnrotatedAttachmentPoint 
  public RegistrationPoint getUnrotatedAttachmentPoint()
Returns the attachment point, not taking rotation into account. Most callers will want to use getAttachmentPoint instead, which does take rotation into account.
See Also:
getAttachmentPoint
setUnrotatedAttachmentPoint 
  public void setUnrotatedAttachmentPoint(RegistrationPoint newAttachmentPoint)
Sets the name and offset of the registration point that connects this cel to its containing segment. This offset should not take rotation into account.
See Also:
getAttachmentPoint, getUnrotatedAttachmentPoint
getRotation 
  public int getRotation()
How many degrees clockwise the art for this cel should be rotated.
setRotation 
  public void setRotation(int newValue)
Sets how many degrees clockwise the art for this cel should be rotated. Computes and stores the rotated registration points.
See Also:
getRotation, getRegistrationPoints
getRegistrationPoints 
  public Vector getRegistrationPoints()
Returns the vector of RegistrationPoints defined by this cel. The vector is null if this segment is not a container (as specified by the CostumeSegment object). The offsets of the registration points are relative to this cel's attachment point. The first registration point listed is the one corresponding to the attachment point, and its offset is always 0,0, since by definition the cel can't move the attachment point. If rotation is non-zero, the registration points will be rotated appropriately.
See Also:
RegistrationPoint
getUnrotatedRegistrationPoints 
  public Vector getUnrotatedRegistrationPoints()
Returns the vector of RegistrationPoints defined by this cel, not accounting for rotation. Most callers will use getRegistrationPoints instead
See Also:
getRegistrationPoints
setUnrotatedRegistrationPoints 
  public void setUnrotatedRegistrationPoints(Vector newPoints)
Sets the vector of unrotated RegistrationPoints defined by this cel.
See Also:
getRegistrationPoints, getUnrotatedRegistrationPoints
unrotatedRegistrationPointFor 
  public RegistrationPoint unrotatedRegistrationPointFor(RegistrationPoint rotatedRP)
Returns the unrotated registration point that corresponds to a given rotated registration point.
rotatedRegistrationPointFor 
  public RegistrationPoint rotatedRegistrationPointFor(RegistrationPoint rp)
Returns the rotated registration point that corresponds to a given unrotated registration point.
rotateRegistrationPoints 
  public void rotateRegistrationPoints()
Generates rotated registration points from unrotated registration points and rotation degrees. Called from setRotation. Occasionally called from other code that's creating/manipulating costume cels.

  public String classNameToEncode(RtEncoder encoder)
